arts.ttl: How Isaksen Regained His Role at Lazio Following Near Summer Exit
arts.sum: Gustav Isaksen has only been at Lazio for just over a year. But judging by the numerous highs and lows endured during this period, it surely feels as if he’s been dwelling at the Stadio Olimpico for much longer. arts.ttl: Lazio Rank Only Behind Inter, Milan & Roma in Season Ticket Sales
arts.sum: Lazio landed fourth on the Serie A list of season-ticket subscribers, with only the Milanese duo and their crosstown rivals Roma generating larger figures. Reigning Italian champions Inter Milan share the San Siro stadium with their neighbors AC Milan, and interestingly, they both managed to sell circa 40 thousand season tickets as revealed by Transfermarkt.it […] The post Lazio Rank Only Behind Inter, Milan & Roma in Season Ticket Sales appeared first on The Laziali.

arts.ttl: Lotito Explains Lazio Summer Revamp: “When Something Isn’t Working You Change It”
arts.sum: Lazio president Claudio Lotito insists a summer overhaul was necessary following last season’s outcome. The Biancocelesti finished seventh in the Serie A table last term in what was a largely disappointing league campaign. Their former coach Maurizio Sarri resigned from his post in March, making way for Igor Tudor. However, the situation hardly improved during […] The post Lotito Explains Lazio Summer Revamp: “When Something Isn’t Working You Change It” appeared first on The Laziali.

arts.ttl: Lazio vs Hellas Verona | Serie A | Team News & Probable Lineups
arts.sum: After registering a win, a loss and a draw in their first three league outings, Lazio resume their Serie A campaign with an intriguing contest against Hellas Verona. The encounter takes place at the Stadio Olimpico in Rome. It kicks off on Monday, 20:45 local time. Lazio Team News, Injuries, Suspensions & Probable Lineup Marco Baroni confirmed […] The post Lazio vs Hellas Verona | Serie A | Team News & Probable Lineups appeared first on The Laziali.

arts.ttl: Lazio vs. Verona: final fixture of Matchday 4
arts.sum: Lazio manager Marco Baroni, who coached Hellas Verona last season (W9 D11 L18), has lost each of his three previous Serie A matches against the Gialloblu, with his teams failing to score a single goal. Lazio have scored in 20 of their last 21 league games against Hellas Verona (46 goals in the period, an average of 2.2 per game); the only match in the period in which the Biancocelesti haven’t netted against the Gialloblu was a 0-0 draw in February 2020.

arts.ttl: Baroni Discusses Lazio Goalkeepers’ Hierarchy, Castrovilli Omission & Verona Return
arts.sum: Lazio coach Marco Baroni tackled several topics in his pre-match press conference on the eve of the club’s encounter against his former employers Hellas Verona (via La Lazio Siamo Noi). The 60-year-old looked back on his experience with the Gialloblu with pride, insisting he gave his all for the club, while noting that the Biancocelesti […] The post Baroni Discusses Lazio Goalkeepers’ Hierarchy, Castrovilli Omission & Verona Return appeared first on The Laziali.

arts.ttl: Napoli & Juventus Set Sights on Verona Rising Star
arts.sum: Hellas Verona wingback Jackson Tchatchoua has reportedly drawn inquiries from several top clubs, including Napoli and Juventus. According to Calciomercato, the two Serie A heavyweights have dispatched scouts to monitor the 22-year-old's progress at Stadio Marc'Antonio Bentegodi. The post Napoli & Juventus Set Sights on Verona Rising Star appeared first on The Cult of Calcio.
